panels.description: Reports Region Servers with exceptions. Useful to quickly locate a RS with an issue
panels.title: Exceptions

panels.description: Thrown by a region server if it is sent a request for a region it is not serving.
panels.title: Not Serving Region

panels.description: Subclass if the server knows the region is now on another server. This allows the client to call the new region server without calling the master.
panels.title: Region Moved

panels.description: Thrown by a region server if it will block and wait to serve a request. For example, the client wants to insert something to a region while the region is compacting.
panels.title: Region Too Busy

panels.description: Thrown by a region server when receiving more requests of what it can handle
panels.title: Call Queue Too Big

panels.description: Exception thrown if a mutation fails sanity checks.
panels.title: Failed Sanity Check

panels.description: Exception thrown when response is too long
panels.title: Multi Response Too Large

panels.description: Thrown by a RegionServer while doing next() calls on a ResultScanner. Both client and server maintain a nextCallSeq and if they do not match, RS will throw this exception.
panels.title: Out Of Order Scanner Next

panels.description: Thrown when the server side has received an Exception, and asks the Client to reset the scanner state by closing the current region scanner, and reopening from the start of last seen row.
panels.title: Scanner Reset

panels.description: Thrown if a region server is passed an unknown scanner id. Usually means the client has take too long between checkins and so the scanner lease on the serverside has expired OR the serverside is closing down and has cancelled all leases.
panels.title: Unknown Scanner
